text: Ishaat Hussain is an Indian businessman and the former director of Tata Sons and Tata Steel, and chairman of Tata Sky. He was also chairman of the Tata Group company, Voltas. Between November 2016 and September 2017, he served as the interim chairman of Tata Consultancy Services, following the removal of Cyrus Mistry. He joined the Tata Group in 1981 and retired in September 2017. ==Education== Hussain went to The Doon School in Dehradun, and then obtained a bachelor's degree in economics from St. Stephen's College, Delhi. He then attended the advance management programme at the Harvard Business School. ==Career== After graduation, Hussain worked as a chartered accountant for seven years, before joining the Tata Group in 1981 In 1999, he joined the board of Tata Sons. He became chairman of Voltas in 2000, and was appointed to the board, and served as the finance director, of Tata Sons.https://ftalphaville.ft.com/2008/05/02/12760/tata-plans-banking-arm-if- rules-ease/| In November 2016, he was appointed interim chairman of Tata Consultancy Services, after Cyrus Mistry was removed, following the much publicised feud with the board of Tata Sons. ==Personal life== Hussain was married to the conceptual artist Rummana Hussain, till her death in 1999. ==References== ==External links== * Tata Consultancy Services Category:Living people Category:Tata Group people Category:1947 births Category:Tata Consultancy Services people Category:Indian chief executives Category:The Doon School alumni Category:St. Stephen's College, Delhi alumni Category:Indian business executives Category:Indian businesspeople Category:Harvard Business School Advanced Management Program attendees
